By Lisa Shock on Sunday, June 9, 2002 - 11:41 pm:

Actually, while I did send email about him, I never received a reply. And, before a bunch of other people get the idea to ask, remember that I was allowed by Tecmo US to send one letter via their translator, directly to the programmers, where I asked about King Ape, Resistance, and the all 25s Monol. This was about a year ago. Other inquiries to the Japanese have taken less time (MR3 battle sense), and some have taken longer (God's Slate). One day they may reply, but at this point, due to the nature of this issue, I doubt it.

The fact is, once a game ships, the developers don't spend time playing it to death. They have other games to move on to making. They have no incentive to figure out why a particular enemy monster is somehow not available due to a bug in the software.

By The D on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 11:30 am:

Can't there be different kinds/pressings of the US monster rancher? To where some people on their pressing have the King and the others with another pressing can't encounter him, no matter how hard they try.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 12:05 pm:

No. Because that would imply that the software was re-written, and then things like gameshark codes wouldn't work on everyone's copy, and memory locations for hacking would be in different places. All of those things are consistent every time.

It would also mean sending a new master to the Sony factory, and incredibly expensive process.

Tecmo never went back and re-wrote the game, they moved onto other projects. They produce a lot of games every year. And, it's simply not economically feasible to spend the money on salaries and pressing costs.

No one even started talking about not seeing King Ape until Dark Phoenix started working on finding him about a year ago. It's not like an outright bug in the game, like the swim bug, or the double lifespan hit at errantry, or the inability to get certain techs. One would think that if Tecmo spent an extra couple hundred thousand dollars re-working the game, that they'd fix those far more obvious bugs.

By The D on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 03:16 pm:

But they did come up with a new cover to MR2, thats why I got the idea.

Also, I see what your saying Lisa. If they were to make a new pressing then they would of fixed those things.

By Dark Phoenix on Thursday, July 18, 2002 - 04:16 am:

May I postulate a theory?

I noticed in my experiments that each of the other S class errantry opponents only appeared after a certain events have occured in the game. Each Class S opponent appears to be unlocked by what I call "trigger events". According to my info, the trigger events for the other Class S errantry monsters are as follows:

Sniper - Finding the Spear in the Mandy Desert Errantry.
Jill - Finding the Big Footstep on the Torles Expedition.
Zilla King - Digging up the Hot Springs using a Hopper
Blue Phoenix - Kawrea Volcano Eruption

According to this pattern, the King Ape should have a
"trigger event" as well. My theory is that King Ape's
appearance is triggered by an event that is linked to the Pocketstation game. However, the Pocketstation game was deleted, so....

By Kio on Thursday, August 15, 2002 - 04:54 pm:

Yes, I'm new. I've tried re-loading my game from the same spot, and I haven't been able to get results. I have no clue what the trigger is. Maybe it's random? I don't know. In awhile, though, I'll find someone with a scanner. I took a picture of the screen with a disposable camera when I first found king ape, so when the film is developed, I'll find a buddy to scan it for me and I'll post it. My method of raising it, though is freestyle. I just focused on raising his power with light drills. His intelligence got high as I sent him on errantries to look for king ape. I didn't feed him any items, but I had a lump of ice, and a Gemini's pot in my inventory. I rested him whenever Colt said "He seems well". Battles were just to make money to send him on the errantries. Also he battled to raise his rank to B, because all the reports of King Ape have been made with a B Class monster. So once I got him up to Grade B, I did nothing but send him on errantries to search for King Ape. When he asked for an item, I gave it to him half the time, and I fed him on milk until he got past 6 months, which he liked, and after, it was nothing but cup jellies, which he had no reaction to. I sent him on all the expeditions he was invited to.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, August 15, 2002 - 08:52 pm:

So far, only a about 3 people playing the US version have ever claimed to have seen it. And 2 of them have done so in this thread, both right after coming to the site. Thousands of other players, all with hundreds of years of gameplay under their belts, have never seen it. Several people, like DP, have spent hundreds of game years searching for King Ape in an organized manner. DP even tried to hack the game to trigger the event. And, while he could trigger other enemies, he could not trigger King Ape.

Like other extremely rare/impossible occurences some types of new players are drawn to post about them to attempt to establish themselves as 'special' on the site. Just remeber that we are looking fo reproducable results, not memories of things from weeks gone by.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, August 15, 2002 - 09:06 pm:

1) "Sorry again, as coincidence should occur, my cousin deleted my only game save, after I encountered him, so now I'm starting again from day 1."

By Bladerunner on Sunday, August 18, 2002 - 03:15 pm:

You are correct, I am supposed to prove myself. Although technically I was proving Kio. My point on the 13 or 30 attempts isn't enough is that using basic statistics, 30 attempts isn't enough. The magic number in statistics is 11. So if there are 16 random possible errantry endings (1 no battle and 15 opponents) and assuming the chance of each outcome is equally possible (a very large assumption), then 11 x 16 is 176. That means if you do 176 int errantries you are 95% likely to encounter the King Ape at least once. Note you still have a 5% chance of not seeing him. The math gets much more complicated if the chances of each outcome are not equal.

Kio posted that he restarted and found the King Ape a second time. So I went to my recently started game and tried. I was duplicating his results. When I posted my results and offered my best available proof, I was dismissed without even having my evidence examined. And yes, I'm getting a little irate. If you look back at my posting history, you'll notice I put up a low cost, work with any monster, no special items requirement method that works better than any similar method on this site. Yet I obviously have no credibility but you do.
